title: Romantic Valentine single-purpose interactive page (Yes/No evasive button + photo reveal)

requirements.text: Create a single-page romantic Valentine experience that asks: "Will you be my Valentine, Tamanna?" with exactly two visible options: "Yes" and "No".

quotes:
Create an interactive web page as a surprise for my girlfriend... ask her to be my Valentine Tamanna.
There should be two options: Yes or No.

acceptanceCriteria: The main view contains the question text "Will you be my Valentine, Tamanna?".
The page has no additional primary flows or navigation beyond this interaction.

requirements.text: Implement the evasive "No" button behavior: when the user hovers over or points at "No", it moves to a different position so it is difficult/impossible to click.

quotes: When she hovers her cursor over No, it should move away so she cannot click it, forcing her to click only on Yes.

acceptanceCriteria: On desktop/laptop, when the pointer enters or hovers the "No" button, the button relocates within the visible card/container bounds.
On touch devices (iPad), when the user attempts to tap the "No" button (e.g., touchstart/pointerdown), the button relocates before a click can be registered.
The "No" button never triggers a success state or image reveal.

requirements.text: Implement the "Yes" click behavior: on clicking "Yes", replace the prompt/buttons with a success view that displays the provided photo and the message "Good choice".

quotes: When she clicks Yes, show her a the image i paste here telling her "Good choice

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "Yes" transitions to a success view/state without reloading the page.
The success view shows the text "Good choice" exactly.
The success view displays one of the user-provided uploaded images (Tamanna.jpeg or Tamanna-1.jpeg) at a reasonable size for iPad screens.

requirements.text: Apply a consistent romantic theme using a pink-and-white color scheme, with cohesive typography, spacing, and subtle romantic UI accents (e.g., hearts, soft gradients, gentle animations) while keeping the page simple and single-purpose.

quotes: The page should be simple, romantic-themed... The page should be themed romantically with a pink and white color scheme

acceptanceCriteria: Primary background and UI surfaces use a pink/white palette (no dominant unrelated color scheme).
The UI looks coherent (consistent button styles, fonts, spacing).
Animations (if any) are subtle and do not interfere with the Yes/No interaction.

requirements.text: Ensure the page works smoothly on iPad Chrome: responsive layout, large tap targets, and interaction handling that does not depend solely on mouse hover.

quotes: be fully interactive using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript so that I can easily run it on my iPad using Chrome.

acceptanceCriteria: Layout adapts to common iPad viewport sizes without overflowing or requiring horizontal scroll.
Buttons meet comfortable tap target sizing (at least ~44px height) and are easy to interact with.
The evasive behavior functions via pointer/touch events on iPad (not only CSS :hover).

constraints: Frontend must be implemented in the existing React + TypeScript + Tailwind stack (no standalone plain HTML file requirement), while still delivering an HTML/CSS/JS-like single-page experience in the browser.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or any other immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT; compose those components instead if needed.
No third-party auth or external services are required/used.
nonGoals: Storing responses or analytics in the backend.
Multi-page navigation, chat, or any additional features beyond the Valentine prompt and success reveal.
